alert.note: Alert for Berks; Bucks; Lehigh; Montgomery; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 1:19PM EST until February 19 at 2:15PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Berks County in eastern Pennsylvania... Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... Northwestern Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... West central Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... South central Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 215 PM EST. * At 118 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Snyders to near Richland, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts over 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions. * This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 45 and 62. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 8, and between mile markers 10 and 67. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 11. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Reading, Bethlehem, Emmaus, Wyomissing, Hellertown, Kutztown, Hamburg, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, East Greenville, Womelsdorf, Wernersville, Topton, Robesonia, Leesport, Shoemakersville, Bally and Bernville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
